panels.description: Shows health per partition and pod
panels.title: Health

panels.description: Shows when and how often a pod was restarted.  The graph is zero when the pod is ready. With this it is also possible to determine how long it take for the pod to come ready again.
panels.title: Pod Restarts

panels.description:
Shows when a role change has happened. 
1 = Follower
2 = Candidate
3 = Leader
2 -
panels.title: Role changes over time

panels.description: Flow node instances completed or terminated per second over all partitions.
panels.title: Overall FNI  per s [1m]

panels.description: Requests which hit the gateway and a response have been sent to the client per second.
panels.title: Requests handled by Gateway per sec

panels.description: Takes the avg of all completed tasks per second over the given time range.
panels.title: Completed Tasks in avg overtime per sec

panels.description: Takes the avg of all completed processes per second over the given time range.
panels.title: Completed Processes in avg overtime per sec

panels.description: Shows the processing queue size over time. Processing queue defines, what is already appended but not yet processed by the stream processor.

targets.expr: max by (partition) (zeebe_log_appender_last_appended_position{namespace=~"$namespace", partition=~"$partition"}) - max by (partition) (zeebe_stream_processor_last_processed_position{namespace=~"$namespace", partition=~"$partition"})

panels.title: Processing Queue size

targets.expr: sum by (pod) (rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total{job="kubelet", cluster="", namespace=~"$namespace", image!="", pod_name=~"$pod", container_name!="POD"}[1m]))

panels.description: Shows the execution time of a process instance. This means the time (latency) between creating the instance and completing it.
panels.title: Process Instance Execution Time (avg)

panels.description: Memory limits and requests are taken from the k8 pod metrics.
panels.title: Process memory usage
